title: Something similar to Lubalin Graph, diffrent serifs
content:
Hi, I found this in a swedish poster for ICA (some kind of small market). It looks like Lubalin graph, but got lovely serifs.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130803171721im_/http:/typophile.com/files/grav_4432.jpg)

thanks..

comments.content: I’d say it is a modified ITC Lubalin Graph, nothing more.

I saw that today as well. It runs as a campaign on billboards all over town (Stockholm, Sweden). They are gathering peoples best recipe for "husmanskost" (plain food, cooking, homely fare, whatever) for a new cookbook. You can also see it on [ICA's site](http://web.archive.org/web/20130803171721/http:/www.ica.se/FrontServlet?s=mat_recept&state=mat_recept_dynamic&viewid=1119632). I think it's quite nice...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130803171721im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ICA_typo_6436.gif)

It's not the same, but Harold's Fonts has a typeface that has similar indents on the serifs

[http://www.haroldsfonts.com/frontpage.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20130803171721/http:/www.haroldsfonts.com/frontpage.html "http://www.haroldsfonts.com/frontpage.html")
Yup, its called MADFONT and it's available for free.
Madfont isn't even close. No cigar.
